description: After a sleepless night, Nikola Petrak decides to unlock the BCI’s confessional logs and hidden Council orders, compelled by mounting unrest and pleas from trusted contacts. He initiates secure parameters to ensure public release, knowing the risk.

A discreet internal alert is sent to the Council and senior officials, warning them that the BCI will publish classified confessions and directives. Panic and hurried discussions break out among Council factions.
The BCI announces a citywide confessions broadcast, urging residents to witness the unveiling of hidden histories. Crowds gather in public spaces as social tension mounts.

BCI confessions go live, exposing manipulative Council directives and cover-ups, detailing how key individuals’ fates were shaped. Names of responsible officials and specifics of unjust restrictions are revealed to all.

Stenograd erupts with debate and demonstrations. Civic leaders and voices like Oksana Lintz and Rada Miskovic call for open discussions on whether to pursue justice or reconciliation. The city stands divided, uncertain of its next move.
